intro: Phrodus nodosus, commonly known as the nodding phrodus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, drooping inflorescences. The plant features compound leaves with opposite arrangement and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
